required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Difluprednate Pediatric Study for the Treatment of Inflammation Post-Cataract Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIIB, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Masked, Parallel-Group, Active-Controlled Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Difluprednate Ophthalmic Emulsion, 0.05% (Durezol™) 4 Times Daily (QID) and Prednisolone Acetate Ophthalmic Suspension, 1.0% (Pred Forte™) QID for the Treatment of Inflammation Following Cataract Surgery in Children 0 to 3 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study was to compare the safety and efficacy of Durezol™ compared to Pred Forte™ for the treatment of inflammation following cataract surgery in a pediatric population 0 to 3 years of age.

detailed_description.textblock: Parents or guardians instilled patients' assigned study medications once on the day of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times daily (QID) beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days followed by a tapering period of 14 days (dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment). Patients were evaluated for safety and efficacy on the following visits: Day 0 (day of surgery), Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days and Day 29 ± 2 days (end of study drug treatment). Additional safety visits occurred at 1 week after the last dose + 2 days and at 3 Months + 1 week. No inferential statistical analysis was planned for this study. Data was summarized using descriptive statistics.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With an Anterior Cell Grade of 0 (no Cells) at Day 15 ± 2 Days
primary_outcome.description: Anterior cell grade was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 5-point scale: Grade 0=0 cells; Grade 1=1 to 10 cells; Grade 2=11 to 20 cells; Grade 3=21 to 50 cells; Grade 4=>50 cells. The presence of blood cells (red and white) in the anterior chamber of the eye (the fluid-filled space inside the eye between the iris and the cornea's innermost surface) is a sign of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment Score of Postoperative Inflammation by Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: A Global Assessment Score (GAS) was assigned by the Investigator based on the clinical evidence of postoperative inflammation: 0=clear, 1=improving satisfactorily; 2=not improving or worsening, withdrawal from study indicated to allow appropriate alternative therapy to be instituted. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Anterior Chamber Cell Grade
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Anterior chamber cell grade was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 5-point scale: Grade 0=0 cells; Grade 1=1 to 10 cells; Grade 2=11 to 20 cells; Grade 3=21 to 50 cells; Grade 4=>50 cells. The presence of blood cells (red and white) in the anterior chamber of the eye (the fluid-filled space inside the eye between the iris and the cornea's innermost surface) is a sign of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Anterior Chamber Flare Grade
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Anterior chamber flare was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. The presence of flare (increased protein levels) in the anterior chamber of the eye (the fluid-filled space inside the eye between the iris and the cornea's innermost surface) is a sign of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Corneal Clarity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Corneal clarity was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Lack of corneal clarity (1-3) is a sign of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Conjunctival Injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Conjunctival injection was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Conjunctival injection (redness of the white sclera of the eye) is a sign of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Ciliary/Limbal Injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Ciliary/limbal injection was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Ciliary/limbal injection (redness of the white sclera of the eye near the limbal ring) is a sign of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Chemosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Chemosis was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Chemosis (swelling of the conjunctiva) is a sign of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Hypopyon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Hypopyon was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Hypopyon (pus in the anterior chamber of the eye) is a sign of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Vitritis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Vitritis was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Vitritis (accumulation of inflammatory cells or exudates in the vitreous humor, the fluid that fills the middle chamber of the eye) is a sign of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Wound Integrity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Wound integrity was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Lack of wound integrity (healing, 1-3) is a sign of inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Photophobia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Photophobia was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Photophobia (abnormal intolerance to visual perception of light) is a symptom of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Lacrimation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Lacrimation was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Excessive lacrimation (tear production and secretion, 1-3) is a symptom of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.

arm_group.description: Difluprednate ophthalmic emulsion, 0.05%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

Prednisolone acetate ophthalmic suspension, 1.0%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 0 to 3 years of age.
- Undergoing uncomplicated cataract extraction in 1 eye with or without intraocular lens.
- Informed consent signed by a parent or legal guardian.
- Other protocol-defined inclusion criteria may apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any active or suspected viral, bacterial, or fungal disease in the study eye.
- Use of any topical medication in the study within 7 days prior to surgery, except for drops that are needed to examine the eye or to prepare for surgery.
- Patients with posttraumatic cataract.
- Active uveitis in the study eye.
- Ocular neoplasm in the study eye.
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV); acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).
- Suspected permanent low vision or blindness in the fellow nonstudy eye. The study eye must not be the patient's only good eye.
- Patients on systemic steroids or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.
- History of steroid-induced intraocular pressure (IOP) rise.
- Currently on medication for ocular hypertension or glaucoma in the study eye.
- Diabetes.
- Other protocol-defined exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center For Trial Locations

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were screened and recruited from 17 study centers located within the United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This reporting group includes all patients who were exposed to the study drug. One patient randomized to DUREZOL withdrew consent prior to receiving study medication.

group.title: DUREZOL
group.description: Difluprednate ophthalmic emulsion, 0.05%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

group.title: PRED FORTE
group.description: Prednisolone acetate ophthalmic suspension, 1.0%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

baseline.population: Baseline characteristics are presented for all patients who were exposed to the study drug.

group.description: Difluprednate ophthalmic emulsion, 0.05%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

class.title: Infants and Toddlers: 28 days to 23 months

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With an Anterior Cell Grade of 0 (no Cells) at Day 15 ± 2 Days
outcome.description: Anterior cell grade was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 5-point scale: Grade 0=0 cells; Grade 1=1 to 10 cells; Grade 2=11 to 20 cells; Grade 3=21 to 50 cells; Grade 4=>50 cells. The presence of blood cells (red and white) in the anterior chamber of the eye (the fluid-filled space inside the eye between the iris and the cornea's innermost surface) is a sign of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): All patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication. One patient (DUREZOL) had missing anterior cell grade assessment at all visits.

outcome.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Hypopyon
outcome.description: Hypopyon was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Hypopyon (pus in the anterior chamber of the eye) is a sign of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): All patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: DUREZOL
group.description: Difluprednate ophthalmic emulsion, 0.05%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

group.title: PRED FORTE
group.description: Prednisolone acetate ophthalmic suspension, 1.0%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

measure.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Hypopyon
measure.description: Hypopyon was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Hypopyon (pus in the anterior chamber of the eye) is a sign of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): All patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Vitritis
outcome.description: Vitritis was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Vitritis (accumulation of inflammatory cells or exudates in the vitreous humor, the fluid that fills the middle chamber of the eye) is a sign of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week

group.title: PRED FORTE
group.description: Prednisolone acetate ophthalmic suspension, 1.0%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

measure.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Vitritis
measure.description: Vitritis was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Vitritis (accumulation of inflammatory cells or exudates in the vitreous humor, the fluid that fills the middle chamber of the eye) is a sign of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): All patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Wound Integrity
outcome.description: Wound integrity was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Lack of wound integrity (healing, 1-3) is a sign of inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): All patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.description: Difluprednate ophthalmic emulsion, 0.05%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

group.title: PRED FORTE
group.description: Prednisolone acetate ophthalmic suspension, 1.0%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

measure.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Wound Integrity
measure.description: Wound integrity was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Lack of wound integrity (healing, 1-3) is a sign of inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): All patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Photophobia
outcome.description: Photophobia was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Photophobia (abnormal intolerance to visual perception of light) is a symptom of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week

measure.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Photophobia
measure.description: Photophobia was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Photophobia (abnormal intolerance to visual perception of light) is a symptom of intraocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): All patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Lacrimation
outcome.description: Lacrimation was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Excessive lacrimation (tear production and secretion, 1-3) is a symptom of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 8 ± 1 day, Day 15 ± 2 days, Day 29 ± 2 days, 1 Week after Last Dose + 2 days, 3 Months + 1 week

measure.title: Global Assessment of Inflammation - Individual Component Scoring by Visit: Lacrimation
measure.description: Lacrimation was assessed by the Investigator during slit lamp or ophthalmoscopy/light examination and graded on a 4-point scale: 0=absent; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe. Excessive lacrimation (tear production and secretion, 1-3) is a symptom of ocular inflammation. A score of 0 indicates an absence of inflammation. For this outcome measure, percentage of patients by grade and visit is reported.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): All patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected for the duration of the study. The safety population includes all patients who were exposed to the study drug.
reported_events.desc: An adverse event was considered to be any untoward medical occurrence in the health of a patient who was exposed to study medication, regardless of causal relationship with the study medication. Adverse events were obtained as solicited comments from the study patients and as observations by the study Investigator as outlined in the study protocol.

group.title: DUREZOL
group.description: Difluprednate ophthalmic emulsion, 0.05%, 1 drop in the study eye at the end of surgery (Day 0) and 4 times a day beginning on the day after surgery (Day 1) for 14 days, followed by a tapering period of 14 days, dependent upon the Investigator's determination of adequate response to treatment

event.description: Not related. Hospital admission was required for procedures involving surgery/anesthesia of certain infants.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.
